sen.e: Immediately after taking office, in 1662, Mitsukuni therefore commanded Tsunetaka MOCHIZUKI the machi-bugyo (city governor under the authority of the shogunate) to install a plumbing system.

sen.j: 元禄4年（1691年）、西山荘に隠棲した。

sen.j: 元禄5年（1693年）には水戸藩の藩医であった穂積甫庵（鈴木宗与）に命じて救民妙薬を編集し、薬草から397種の製薬方法を記させた。
sen.e: In 1693 he commissioned Hoan HOZUMI (Soyo SUZUKI) the domain's physician to compile the Kyumin Myoyaku, a book on herbal medicine with the recipes for 397 medicinal drugs.

sen.e: On January 8, 1695 he invited shogunal cabinet ministers and daimyo (territorial lords) to a Noh-dancing performance during which he struck down Mondayu FUJII who was his senior vassal in a private, locked room.

sen.j: 光圀は、兄（頼重）を差し置いて藩主になったことを後悔していたといわれる。

sen.j: 日本の歴史上、最初に光圀が食べたとされるものは、ラーメンをはじめ、餃子、チーズ、牛乳酒、黒豆納豆がある。

sen.j: 肉食が忌避されていたこの時代に、光圀は5代将軍徳川綱吉が制定した生類憐れみの令を無視して牛肉、豚肉、ヒツジなどを食べていた。
sen.e: At a time when meat diet was avoided, Mitsukuni ignored the Shorui Awaremi no Rei (Instructions concerning compassion for all living creatures) issued by Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA the fifth Shogun, eating beef, pork and mutton.

sen.j: さらに、吉原遊郭近郊の浅草界隈で見た手打ちうどんの技術を自ら身につけ、うどんを打つこともあったという。
sen.e: He moreover learned how to make handmade udon (Japanese wheat noodles) which he saw in Asakusa near the Yoshiwara red-light district and made them at home.

sen.j: 光圀は政治を例えて「男色ではなく女色のようにしなければならない」と言った。
sen.e: He described politics as 'something which one must do in a heterosexual, rather than homosexual, fashion.'

sen.j: 女色は両方が快楽を得るが男色は片方だけ快楽であり片方にとっては苦痛でしかない。
sen.e: While both parties derive pleasure from the heterosexual relationship, only one party feels pleasure, leaving the other in pain, in the homosexual relationship.

sen.e: Later, in 1685, he commissioned Tsunehisa KAWAI and other retainers to compile "Shinpen Kamakurashi" (Newly Edited Guide to Kamakura) based on 'Kamakura Nikki.'

sen.j: 享保元年（1716年）に将軍・徳川家継の後継者選びが行われた。
sen.e: In 1716 a heir to Shogun Ietsugu TOKUGAWA was selected.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1716 an heir to Shogun Ietsugu TOKUGAWA was selected.
In 1716 an heir to Shogun Ietsugu TOKUGAWA was selected.

sen.j: 綱條が徳川御三家の当主の内、最年長であるにも関わらず、紀州藩主・徳川吉宗が後継者に選ばれた。
sen.e: The selected heir was Yoshimune TOKUGAWA, lord of Kishu Domain although Tsunaeda was the eldest among the lords of the three Tokugawa families.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The selected heir was Yoshimune TOKUGAWA, lord of Kishu Domain although Tsunaeda was the eldest among the lords of the three Tokugawa families.
The selected heir was Yoshimune TOKUGAWA, lord of the Kishu Domain although Tsunaeda was the eldest among the lords of the three Tokugawa families.

sen.j: 以後、水戸徳川家からは将軍を出さなかった。
sen.e: No member of the Mito-Tokugawa family had since become shogun.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: No member of the Mito-Tokugawa family had since become shogun.
No member of the Mito-Tokugawa family had since become shogun.

sen.j: 将軍の補佐役として参勤交代を行わず江戸に定府することとなる。
sen.e: As advisor to the shogun they were ordered to live in Edo permanently and hence they were no longer required to carry on 'Sankin-kotai' (a system in which the feudal lords were required to spend every other year in their residences in Edo).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As advisor to the shogun, they were ordered to live permanently in Edo and hence they were no longer required to carry on 'Sankin-kotai' (a system in which the feudal lords were required to spend every other year in their residences in Edo).

As advisor to the shogun, they were ordered to live permanently in Edo and hence they were no longer required to carry on 'Sankin-kotai' (a system in which the feudal lords were required to spend every other year in their residences in Edo).

sen.j: 常に将軍の傍に居る事から水戸藩主は（俗に）「（天下の）副将軍」と呼ばれるようになる。
sen.e: The lords of the Mito Domain were (commonly) called 'Fuku-Shogun (Vice Shogun of the World)' as they always stayed with the shoguns.
The lords of the Mito Domain were (commonly) called 'Fuku-Shogun (Vice Shogun of the World)' as they always stayed with the shoguns.
The lords of the Mito Domain were (commonly) called 'Tenka no Fuku-Shogun (Vice Shogun of the World)' as they always stayed with the shoguns.

sen.j: 結局、2代目藩主・光圀以降、9代藩主・徳川斉昭の七男・徳川慶喜が将軍職に就くまで、水戸徳川家からは将軍職に就く者はいなかった。
sen.e: In the end, Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA who was the seventh son of Nariaki TOKUGAWA, the ninth lord of Mito Domain was the first member of the Mito-Tokugawa family to become shogun after the time of Mitsukuni the second lord.

In the end, Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA who was the seventh son of Nariaki TOKUGAWA, the ninth lord of Mito Domain was the first member of the Mito-Tokugawa family to become shogun after Mitsukuni the second lord.

In the end, Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, who was the seventh son of Nariaki TOKUGAWA, the ninth lord of the Mito Domain, was the first member of the Mito-Tokugawa family to become shogun after Mitsukuni the second lord.
sen.cmt: カンマと冠詞をつけました。

sen.j: また、慶喜は一橋家に養子に出され、そこから将軍職に就いたので、系譜上では水戸徳川家から直接将軍に就いた訳ではない。
sen.e: Genealogically speaking, moreover, he was not of the Mito-Tokugawas as he was adopted out to the Hitotsubashi family and became shogun as Yoshinobu HITOTSUBASHI.
Genealogically speaking, moreover, he was not of the Mito-Tokugawas as he was adopted by the Hitotsubashi family and became shogun as Yoshinobu HITOTSUBASHI.
Genealogically speaking, moreover, he was not of the Mito-Tokugawas as he was adopted by the Hitotsubashi family and became shogun as Yoshinobu HITOTSUBASHI.

sen.j: 光圀の学芸振興が「水戸学」を生み出して後世に大きな影響を与えたことは高く評価されるべきである。
sen.e: Giving rise to 'Mitogaku,' Mitsukuni's promotion of sciences and arts must be highly esteemed as it has had significant impact on later generations.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Giving rise to 'Mitogaku,' Mitsukuni's promotion of the sciences and arts must be highly esteemed as it has had a significant impact on later generations.
Giving rise to 'Mitogaku,' Mitsukuni's promotion of the sciences and arts must be highly esteemed as it has had a significant impact on later generations.

sen.j: だが、その一方で藩財政の悪化を招いた。
sen.e: It however worsened the domain's financial conditions.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It however worsened the domain's financial conditions.
It however worsened the domain's financial conditions.

sen.j: ひいては領民への負担があり、そのため農民の逃散が絶えなかった。
sen.e: It also laid a heavy burden of taxation on the people and many peasants ran away.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It also laid a heavy burden of taxation on the people and many peasants ran away.
It also laid a heavy burden of taxation on the people and many peasants ran away.

sen.j: 一説には光圀時代は年貢比率が八公二民の超重税を強いたと言われる。
sen.e: There is an opinion that the domain imposed extremely high nengu (the annual tax dominated in rice payments) with a tax rate of 80 percent on income under Mitsukuni's rule.
There is an opinion that the domain imposed an extremely high nengu (the annual tax dominated in rice payments) with a tax rate of eighty percent on income under Mitsukuni's rule.
There is an opinion that the domain imposed an extremely high nengu (the annual tax dominated in rice payments) with a tax rate of eighty percent on income under Mitsukuni's rule.

sen.j: 結果的には「水戸学」が目指した“愛民”の理想からは逸脱してしまった側面も存在しる。
sen.e: Consequently, there was an aspect in which Mitsukuni deviated from the ideal of "aimin" (care for the people) which 'Mitogaku' intended to achieve.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Consequently, Mitsukuni deviated from the ideal of "aimin" (care for the people) which 'Mitogaku' intended to achieve.
Consequently, Mitsukuni deviated from the ideal of "aimin" (care for the people) which 'Mitogaku' intended to achieve.

sen.j: 単純に「名君」として評することはできない。
sen.e: We cannot simply praise him as 'a wise ruler.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: We cannot simply praise him as 'a wise ruler.'
We cannot simply praise him as 'a wise ruler.'

sen.j: 水戸徳川家は、徳川氏が天皇（朝廷）と対立した場合、徳川の血筋を残すために天皇側につくように定められていた。
sen.e: The Mito-Tokugawa family made it a rule to take sides with the emperor should any conflict arise between the Tokugawa clan and the emperor (imperial court).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Mito-Tokugawa family made it a rule to take sides with the emperor should any conflict arise between the Tokugawa clan and the emperor (imperial court).
The Mito-Tokugawa family made it a rule to take sides with the emperor should any conflict arise between the Tokugawa clan and the emperor (or the Imperial Court).

sen.j: 将軍を出さないよう決められていたとの考え（井沢元彦『逆説の日本史』など）もある。
sen.e: They therefore agreed not to produce a shogun (according to "Gyakusetsu no Nihonshi" (A Paradoxical History of Japan) by Motohiko IZAWA).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They therefore agreed not to produce a shogun (according to "Gyakusetsu no Nihonshi" - A Paradoxical History of Japan, by Motohiko IZAWA).
They therefore agreed not to produce a shogun (according to "Gyakusetsu no Nihonshi" - A Paradoxical History of Japan, by Motohiko IZAWA).

sen.j: それを変えたのが8代将軍吉宗である。
sen.e: It was Yoshimune the eighth shogun who changed the family rule.
It was Yoshimune the eighth shogun who changed the family rule.
It was Yoshimune the eighth shogun who changed the family rule.

sen.j: 出自の紀州徳川家の地位を向上させ、御三家と同種の機能を持つ御三卿を創始するなどした。
sen.e: He raised the status of the Kishu-Tokugawa family of which he was a member and established "gosankyo" (three privileged branches of the Tokugawa family) who had a similar function to the three Tokugawa families.

He raised the status of the Kishu-Tokugawa family to which he belonged and established "gosankyo" (three privileged branches of the Tokugawa family) who had a similar function to the three Tokugawa families.

He raised the status of the Kishu-Tokugawa family to which he belonged and established "gosankyo" (three privileged branches of the Tokugawa family) who had a similar function to the three Tokugawa families.

sen.j: 徳川宗家と御三家の立場やあり方を変えてしまったことに原因があるようだ。
sen.e: He transformed the way the main branch of the Tokugawa family functioned or stood in relation to the three big families, so that the Mito-Tokugawa family had to change their family rule.
sen.cmt: 「原因があるようだ」は曖昧ですが、おそらく吉宗の改革が水戸徳川家から将軍を出すことにつながったということでしょう。しかし後続と内容がかぶるので、三つ前の列から家訓を破ったとしました。
sen.e: He transformed the way the main branch of the Tokugawa family functioned or stood in relation to the three big families, so that the Mito-Tokugawa family had to change their family rule.
He transformed the way the main branch of the Tokugawa family functioned or stood in relation to the three big families, so that the Mito-Tokugawa family had to change their family rule.

sen.j: そのため出るはずのなかった水戸徳川家からの将軍が出ることになった。
sen.e: That is why the Mito-Tokugawa family who cannot have produced a shogun did so.
That is why the Mito-Tokugawa family who could not have produced a shogun, actually did so.
That is why the Mito-Tokugawa family who could not have produced a shogun, actually did so.

sen.j: 正室：近衛信尋の娘・近衞尋子（泰姫）
sen.e: His seihitsu (legal wife) was Hiroko KONOE (Taihime), daughter of Nobuhiro KONOE.
His seihitsu (legal wife) was Hiroko KONOE (Taihime), daughter of Nobuhiro KONOE.

sen.j: 側室：玉井氏
sen.e: His concubine was a woman of the Tamai clan.
His concubine was a woman of the Tamai clan.

sen.j: 長男：松平頼常
sen.e: His eldest son was Tsuneyori MATSUDAIRA.
His eldest son was Tsuneyori MATSUDAIRA.

sen.j: 長女：戸田光規室
sen.e: His eldest daughter was the wife of Mitsunori TODA.
His eldest daughter was the wife of Mitsunori TODA.

sen.j: 父・頼房や同時代の他の大名と比較して、長命を全うした大名としては非常に寂しい家族関係である。
sen.e: Compared with his father Yorifusa and his contemporary daimyo lords, he had a rather poor family relationship although he lived a long life.
Compared with his father Yorifusa and his contemporary daimyo lords, he had a rather poor family relationship although he lived a long life.

sen.j: 幼少時の扱いがトラウマとして影を落としたのではないかという説もある。
sen.e: There is a view that this had something to do with his traumatic childhood.
There is a view that it had something to do with his traumatic childhood.
